channel.title: Approving a tutorial? Look here first!
channel.description:
Alright, seeing as `Rich and I have just spent the past few hours going through the tutorials section to ensure proper procedure was being used. The outcome, was that there was a lot of "iffy" topics, of which did not follow the code conventions, but were good tutorials overall. Yes, we want the good tutorials to be accepted, however we don't want others learning bad coding habits. So, from this day forward, you do not accept a topic unless:
[ul][li]It complies with all current rules and guidelines[/li] [li]There is not already a topic regarding the subject[/li] [li]It is not copy and paste[/li] [li]It follows proper Java Code Conventions[/li] [li]It does not put any user reading it at risk (for example, a portforwarding guide is posted telling a user how to use their modem to portforward without a router, which makes them prone to attacks and such[/li][/ul]
And of course, remember when denying topics to use this BBC format: [code]Hi,
The topic you recently submitted to the tutorial section was declined because (it was/showed):
[ul][li]A copy and paste tutorial[/li] [li]An unnecessary tutorial (an action that doesn't require a tutorial to produce)[/li] [li]You were unable to prove that you understood what you were talking about[/li] [li]A list of several simple tutorials[/li] [li]Incompleteness[/li][/ul]
We thank you for your tutorial, however we would ask that you next time follow the rules when posting a tutorial so it may be accepted.
Moderator Comment: None [/code]
